understanding.developer_understanding_on_unclear_metho: The unclear code is a method named prevalentSystem() which checks if the prevalent system is configured and throws an exception if it is not.
understanding.developer_understanding_on_unclear_code_: The unclear code is related to the configuration in the sense that it enforces a requirement for the prevalent system to be configured before it can be accessed. This ensures that the system is in a valid state before performing any operations that rely on the prevalent system.

config_description: Cannot found this configuration description for this configuration.
developer_understanding_on_working: The configuration _prevalentSystem is used to initialize the prevalent system in the GenericSnapshotManager. It is passed as a parameter when creating a new instance of GenericSnapshotManager.
developer_understanding_on_triggering_fr: The configuration _prevalentSystem is triggered whenever a new instance of GenericSnapshotManager is created, which depends on the conditions specified in the code.
developer_understanding_on_size_impact: The impact of the _prevalentSystem configuration option on the system is that it influences the behavior of the GenericSnapshotManager and how it manages snapshots and serialization of data.
